Articles.Content:
Meh, it's something they're doing to generate more hype.

Dear Jool in Heavun above I hope they didn't decide to call their introduction of females into the game PROJECT V.
Edited January 23, 2015 by Tw1

Meh, it's something they're doing to generate more hype.

As great as it would be that they're finally getting on with making female kerbals, I concur with the comment above.

I don't, all those engines look to similar.

1. I concur with your statement of concurrence.

2. The engines do look a bit too similar, but the stock ones look to similar as well.

Wait? Do we have confirmation on something? I'm confused.

No, sorry, the guy above me said the name was confirmedÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ I knew it was a real name, and who she was or I would not have posted it, so his use of "confirmed" confused ME.

I see nothing wrong with- OH GOD NO

Maxmaps is probably laughing his head off about the female Kerbal theory.

Maxmaps is probably laughing his head off about the female Kerbal theory.

i dont get it. what's so funny? can anyone please explain? is there anything innapropriate about the letter V, or starts with it?
i dont get it. what's so funny? can anyone please explain? is there anything innapropriate about the letter V, or starts with it?

If it isn't V-meter parts / Size V, then perhaps it's the first letter in the name of a new resource we'll be getting. I recall reading a while back that "deep space refueling" will be a thing, so if that means what I think it means then maybe we'll be mining, uh... Vethane? Varbonite? Veryusefulium?
Maybe they added a victory condition. So there is an actual "ends" to Kerbal space at last. Perhaps with a story line.
Budget cuts at our Space Program. Instead of a Hype Train we now have a Hype Van. Project V - kitting out the Van.

Maybe they added a victory condition. So there is an actual "ends" to Kerbal space at last. Perhaps with a story line.

I hope not. Space exploration should have no end.
Don't you love how the devs complain about speculation, then intentionally do things to create it...

I hope not. Space exploration should have no end.

I mean something like a Minecraft "end" you know? Like, reaching some point where you finally piece together some kind of narrative that you discover along the way of your exploration, do something epic, gets a credit screen, then off you go to discover more things. It is just like a pat in the back from the developers saying you did well and deserve recognition of sort.

Add Fred Pohl's Gateway to the Kerbol system, in a random orbit (changes each career) way out towards the Oort cloud, likely highly inclined. Looks just like an asteroid/comet from any range, but is covered with docking ports (with craft attached). Dock with it, and it has a massive IVA to explore, and crafts that pop you to other systems

Edited January 23, 2015 by tater

'V' - very important name ? Valentina's a good guess but your'e all wrong...

It has to be Vladimir Putin (or Vanamonde).
Valdez. As in Juan. Kerbin is getting a makeover and the whole planet will be covered in coffee fields.
Someone on Reddit said that it could be V for Voyager, which would mean that they're going to add outer planets. I want to believe.
I'm not sure that's revolutionary enough to qualify as "experimental" though.
I hope "V" stands for "Very important stability improvements".
Aaargh this is just painful, I'd rather wait for the actual information than to be teased lol
Vesta = Asteroid belt?

V for 'Verily we have fixed the bugs'?

I'm hoping Unity 5, but I suspect that's not it

V for 'Verily we have fixed the bugs'?

I'm hoping Unity 5, but I suspect that's not it

They already stated that V was the letter, not the roman numeric.

Man... the first thing I thought of when I saw that was "V-model? they're doing validation?"

It may be time for me to take some time off work

I could be now immature and say a thing about another word starting with V.

Good thing Im not.

Hope its a dV readout.
Congratulations, Maxmaps, this is a very emancipated move on your part - although I always expected you to become a good father.
